name: State_8

timeline_beats.label: Naval commercialization; guilds consolidate control of reagents and shipyards
Combat operations in Great Naval War; subsequent anti-piracy campaign
Major contribution to Pirate Suppression Campaign

factions.label: Mariners' Guild (Shipwrights & Pilots)
factions.influence_hint: Controls navigation, pilotage fees, ship construction; high coastal influence

factions.label: Coastal Admiralty
factions.influence_hint: State naval command; high influence on defense and alliance obligations

factions.label: Salt & Fish Consortium
factions.influence_hint: Economic backbone; controls processing and export quotas

factions.label: Ritual Reagent Syndicate
factions.influence_hint: Monopolizes imported reagents and ritual workshops; lever over magic users and merchants

factions.label: Harbor Clans (local noble houses)
factions.influence_hint: Gatekeepers of local ports and militia; variable loyalty between merchants and admiralty

constraints: No instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics
Long-range mind influence is rare and institutionally banned
Navigational auguries cannot replace charts and seamanship
Combustion-derived industry limited; no high-pressure steam megatechs
Ritual magic consumes scarce imported reagents or specialized labor; reagent supply is a strategic constraint
Respect obligations of listed alliances and ongoing wars in external_relations_refs
notes: Strategic chokepoint: Bay of Tides central to trade and defense
Ritual Reagent Syndicate is a single point of failure for magic-dependent industries and naval auguries
Tension: Merchants' Guild vs Coastal Admiralty over convoy policy and privateering
High piracy exposure prior to W3; continued need for anti-piracy patrols
Navigational auguries are institutionalized for pilotage but charts, pilots, and ship skill remain primary
